lead_paragraph: CARR--Sara Maffitt Lockhart, was born April 8, 1924 in Charlotte, NC and died June 8, 2016 in New York City. She was predeceased by her parents Sara Laurens Maffitt Lockhart and James Alexander Lockhart, Jr. of Charlotte, NC and her brother James Alexander Lockhart, III of Charlotte, NC. She is survived by her brother Thomas Ashe Lockhart (Ann) of Charlotte, NC; nephews Thomas Ashe Lockhart, Jr. (Stephanie) of Charlotte, NC, James Wilkinson Lockhart (Julie) of Decatur, GA, John Laurens Lockhart (Amy) of Charleston, SC; nieces Ann Lockhart Mayeux (Craig) of Charlotte, NC and Eloise Lockhart Sample of Ponte Vedra Beach, FL; great-nieces Grace Maffitt Lockhart of Decatur, GA, Charlotte Olivia Laurens Gillman of Charlotte, NC and Ashley Sample Rutland (Taylor) of New Orleans, LA and a great-great-nephew and niece. Sara received her Bachelors degree in Sociology from Women's College at University of North Carolina in 1945. Sara was married and divorced with no children. She was a model as a "Power's Girl" with the John Robert Powers Agency in the 1940's and had lived in New York City for over 60 years. Sara was a member of Saint Thomas Episcopal Church. She loved to travel, go to the opera, watch tennis and discuss politics. She will be greatly missed by her family. A memorial service will be held in the Chantry Chapel at Saint Thomas Church, June 28 at 1pm. Services entrusted to Frank E. Campbell "The Funeral Chapel." 1/3
